text: Ballybritt () is a barony in County Offaly (formerly King's County), Republic of Ireland. ==Etymology== Ballybritt derives its name from Ballybritt Castle (near Roscrea) and the townland of Ballybritt (Irish Baile an Bhriotaigh, "settlement of the Welshman").Logainm.ie ==Location== Ballybritt is located in south County Offaly, west of the Slieve Bloom Mountains. ==History== Ballybritt was included in the northern part of the territory of the Éile (Ely), and in early times was a crossroads for the ancient borders of the kingdoms of Mumu, Mide and Laigin.Ireland's History in Maps: The Baronies of Ireland ==List of settlements== Below is a list of settlements in Ballybritt: *Birr *Cadamstown *Clareen *Crinkill *Kinnitty ==References== Category:Baronies of County Offaly
title: Ballybritt
